channel.title: Host website on my computer?
channel.description: I heard that u can host a website that i made off of your computer , That's what i want to do so that i don't have to pay for a domain.But how do i host a server off off my computer...?

item.title: Host website on my computer?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:6, topic:51075”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=71581.msg812711#msg812711 date=1169611885]

You’ll ISP will love you if you do decide to host a server on your pc though.

Whys that?

And just use xampp

They’ll just love your bandwidth use.
[/quote]
Meh… If your paying for unlimited bandwidth then you might as well go for it

Anyways to answer the question… Yes you can host a website on your computer. But, you’ll need a fast internet connection(DSL might do the trick for a website with not a whole lot… But it’ll be slow as hell especially with more then one person on the site at a time). Download Apache, and read some documentation on it to find out how to properly use it and set it up to host files. And of course then you need to run your computer 24/7(and it will need to be a pretty decent computer). As for a domain, you will still need to purchase one… Really your better off finding a good free host.[/quote]

I’m paying for ‘unlimited’ broadband, 2MB unlimited, but currently and always I’ve been getting 512k because the ISP is shit, and after a few weeks of just regular email and internet(no downloading) use through 6-11pm I’ve been put on the fair usage policy where our internet pretty much sucks from 6pm to 11pm every day. I can’t do shit. I’d like to host a server though to piss em off though.

Read full topic

item.title: Host website on my computer?
item.dc:creator: @mrrules mrrules
item.description:
@mrrules wrote:

Would any one like to help me make a quick paintball team website? Not cause i don’t know html , its just ive been trying to make a main page and the only thing i got is words at the top and a shit navigation bar using

table’s but it doesnt look right. And when i tryed to use css after reading page’s and page’s of it i typed some up but when i saved it to look at it , it did’nt show anything but what i typed…HELP ME someone.

Read full topic

item.title: Host website on my computer?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“leader, post:12, topic:51075”][quote author=jme_009 link=topic=71581.msg813735#msg813735 date=1169624780]

You’ll ISP will love you if you do decide to host a server on your pc though.

Whys that?

And just use xampp

They’ll just love your bandwidth use.

Meh… If your paying for unlimited bandwidth then you might as well go for it

Anyways to answer the question… Yes you can host a website on your computer. But, you’ll need a fast internet connection(DSL might do the trick for a website with not a whole lot… But it’ll be slow as hell especially with more then one person on the site at a time). Download Apache, and read some documentation on it to find out how to properly use it and set it up to host files. And of course then you need to run your computer 24/7(and it will need to be a pretty decent computer). As for a domain, you will still need to purchase one… Really your better off finding a good free host.
[/quote]

There is no way that you can have unlimited bandwidth. People just say that…[/quote]
I am allowed to use all the bandwidth I want. I have bell sympatico high speed. With our old plan my limit was 2 gb per month, so we upgraded to the unlimited bandwidth plan and I use over 100 gb’s a month now.

Read full topic

item.title: Host website on my computer?
item.dc:creator: @Nexus Nexus
item.description:
@Nexus wrote:

On another topic

thats what most ISPs advertise. if they cut you off, /sue

They’ll have a fair use policy in their terms if you use enough to affect other peoples connections they will terminate your account with them/ whatever their terms says relevant to their policy

Read full topic

You’ll ISP will love you if you do decide to host a server on your pc though.

Whys that?

And just use xampp

They’ll just love your bandwidth use.
[/quote]
Meh… If your paying for unlimited bandwidth then you might as well go for it

Anyways to answer the question… Yes you can host a website on your computer. But, you’ll need a fast internet connection(DSL might do the trick for a website with not a whole lot… But it’ll be slow as hell especially with more then one person on the site at a time). Download Apache, and read some documentation on it to find out how to properly use it and set it up to host files. And of course then you need to run your computer 24/7(and it will need to be a pretty decent computer). As for a domain, you will still need to purchase one… Really your better off finding a good free host.[/quote]

There is no way that you can have unlimited bandwidth. People just say that…

You’ll ISP will love you if you do decide to host a server on your pc though.

Whys that?

And just use xampp
[/quote]

They’ll just love your bandwidth use. :)[/quote]
Meh… If your paying for unlimited bandwidth then you might as well go for it

Anyways to answer the question… Yes you can host a website on your computer. But, you’ll need a fast internet connection(DSL might do the trick for a website with not a whole lot… But it’ll be slow as hell especially with more then one person on the site at a time). Download Apache, and read some documentation on it to find out how to properly use it and set it up to host files. And of course then you need to run your computer 24/7(and it will need to be a pretty decent computer). As for a domain, you will still need to purchase one… Really your better off finding a good free host.

@goatee wrote:

You need to buy a seperate server. It’s cheaper to just buy hosting or even get free hosting.
You will also need to pay for the domain if you want a .com/org/co.uk/net.
